New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to post at least 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a single season
Ohtani also became the only player in Dodgers history to record 10 RBIs in a single game
Ohtani finished going 6-for-6 at the plate on the evening
Key Match Events: Ohtani opened up the night with a double, scoring off a Will Smith sacrifice fly to give Los Angeles an early lead
Ohtani would follow in the second inning with a single into right field, scoring his first RBI of the contest
With Gavin Lux advancing to third base, Ohtani pounced on the opportunity with his first stolen base of the night, bringing the slugger to 50 on the year
After electing to pitch to an already 3-for-3 Ohtani in the sixth, the Marlins came to immediately regret this decision
Ohtani took the second pitch he saw 438 feet out to right center, registering two RBIs in the process
Despite being down 12-3 in the seventh inning, the Marlins continued pitching to Ohtani
Relief pitcher Mike Baumann would end up throwing a pitch for the history books
Ohtani walked up to the plate in the ninth inning looking for more
With his squad already down double-digits, Marlins second baseman Vidal Brujan took to the mound to pitch
Brujan elected to pitch to Ohtani, instead of issuing an intentional walk to the slugger
After throwing two consecutive balls, Brujan would throw a 68 mph fastball that Ohtani hammered into deep right center field, scoring three more runs
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani entered the contest with 48 home runs and 49 stolen bases as he closed in on baseball immortality
Others: The Dodgers would go on to clinch a postseason bid following their 20-4 win, improving to a 91-62 record on the season
